ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is the capstone course in (what is in my opinion) the best statistics sequence for the social sciences at Yale. It is a great course to take to cement your understanding of what assumptions we rely on to make causal inferences across a number of different research designs.
I strongly recommend this class to others. This class provide a chance to get advanced research skills and think about your own research in causal inference framework.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Now when I sit in seminars and job-talks I feel much more confident asking questions and thinking about the assumptions behind the speaker's research design.

I haven't had a chance to learn about experiments before. But through this class, I read several experiments articles, dealt with real experiment data, and replicated the analysis in the papers. These series of experiences gave me a good sense of experiments, and now I'm coming up with a survey experiment. So clearly this course contributed to my research a lot.
